revised_title: The Role of Bacteria in Root Nodule Formation and Nitrogen Fixation in Myrica gale
tldr: This study investigates the root nodules of Myrica gale and discovers that they are formed by bacteria, not a fungus as previously thought. The bacteria, identified as Pseudomonas radicicola, are responsible for nitrogen fixation, allowing Myrica gale to thrive in nitrogen-deficient environments. This finding expands the list of non-leguminous plants capable of nitrogen fixation through root nodules.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
